ROP.content: pourquoi mon explication avec l’analyse [psychoanalysis] a toujours eu ce goût de mort en poste restante qui m’a poussé à rôder sans fin dans les parages de Beyond the Pleasure Principle [?]
ROP.linkedContent: pourquoi mon explication avec l’analyse [psychoanalysis] a toujours eu ce goût de mort en poste restante qui m’a poussé à rôder sans fin dans les parages de Beyond the Pleasure Principle [?]

ROP.content: repetition compulsion (advocatus diaboli of death drive) as resource & limit (à la fois) of psychoanalysis > analytic position set going endlessly, w/out Aufhebung, in paradox of Bindung and Erlöschung (solution, extinction): no analytic position when resistance is unidentifiable
ROP.linkedContent: repetition compulsion (advocatus diaboli of death drive) as resource & limit (à la fois) of psychoanalysis > analytic position set going endlessly, w/out Aufhebung, in paradox of Bindung and Erlöschung (solution, extinction): no analytic position when resistance is unidentifiable

ROP.content: was not Freud looking for, in “death drive,” in “repetition compulsion,” the principle before the principle (of pleasure/reality), l’esprit de cette spirale, voilà qui tient en haleine [holds one in suspense], ou si vous aimez mieux: en vie
ROP.linkedContent: was not Freud looking for, in “death drive,” in “repetition compulsion,” the principle before the principle (of pleasure/reality), l’esprit de cette spirale, voilà qui tient en haleine [holds one in suspense], ou si vous aimez mieux: en vie

SPEC.content: Beyond… is a-thetic, no (final) judgment (instance), indefinite suspension re: life death > death drive appears/disappears while telling stories, making scenes: myths, fables (literary)
SPEC.linkedContent: Beyond… is a-thetic, no (final) judgment (instance), indefinite suspension re: life death > death drive appears/disappears while telling stories, making scenes: myths, fables (literary)

SPEC.content: Derrida will distinguish restance from instance (judgment)
SPEC.linkedContent: Derrida will distinguish restance from instance (judgment)

SPEC.content: to account/read the athetic, Derrida unsatisfied w/ dérive (drifting), too continuous/homogenous movement, travels away w/out saccade > prefers double bind, des effondrements de bord, la rive se partage en son trait même
SPEC.linkedContent: to account/read the athetic, Derrida unsatisfied w/ dérive (drifting), too continuous/homogenous movement, travels away w/out saccade > prefers double bind, des effondrements de bord, la rive se partage en son trait même

SPEC.content: Beyond… and Das Unheimliche: devil comes back neither as imaginary representation, nor as an apparition in person: devil comes back “in person” to double his double…a doubling doubling his double, devil overflows his double at moment he’s nothing but his double
SPEC.linkedContent: Beyond… and Das Unheimliche: devil comes back neither as imaginary representation, nor as an apparition in person: devil comes back “in person” to double his double…a doubling doubling his double, devil overflows his double at moment he’s nothing but his double

SPEC.content: dialectics acquits itself [allays uneasiness] of double, opposes mask to original “in person”
SPEC.linkedContent: dialectics acquits itself [allays uneasiness] of double, opposes mask to original “in person”

SPEC.content: visitation of devil, apparition of “thing in itself,” over & above representative that’s supposed to supplement him, supplement of its “own supplement”: expands double-effects, upsets appeasing order of representation, duplicity w/out original > for Rousseau, diabolical brings fright to a climax
SPEC.linkedContent: visitation of devil, apparition of “thing in itself,” over & above representative that’s supposed to supplement him, supplement of its “own supplement”: expands double-effects, upsets appeasing order of representation, duplicity w/out original > for Rousseau, diabolical brings fright to a climax

SPEC.content: which is Freud’s devil? the one that he counterfeits, or the one that he de(for)fends (défendre) [forbids, defends]
SPEC.linkedContent: which is Freud’s devil? the one that he counterfeits, or the one that he de(for)fends (défendre) [forbids, defends]

SPEC.content: neither proof nor disproof of PP, belief in PP suspends belief in PP > the theory is mute about pleasure, only quantitative analysis > unpleasure as translation of pleasure
SPEC.linkedContent: neither proof nor disproof of PP, belief in PP suspends belief in PP > the theory is mute about pleasure, only quantitative analysis > unpleasure as translation of pleasure

SPEC.content: Freud’s speculation aims neither for originality nor priority, the other’s other (philosophy) > aporia of translation imposed in question life death, pleasure–unpleasure, repetition
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s speculation aims neither for originality nor priority, the other’s other (philosophy) > aporia of translation imposed in question life death, pleasure–unpleasure, repetition

SPEC.content: strategy whose finality’s not clear, no known genre, it overflows, thus the hypothesis, the athesis of athesis > asking questions in the dark: Freud’s phosphorescent antennae
SPEC.linkedContent: strategy whose finality’s not clear, no known genre, it overflows, thus the hypothesis, the athesis of athesis > asking questions in the dark: Freud’s phosphorescent antennae

SPEC.content: reality principle just a modification/representation of PP
SPEC.linkedContent: reality principle just a modification/representation of PP

SPEC.content: [vis-à-vis Freud] must try most open, loosest (lockerste, plus lâche) hypothesis to describe pleasure–unpleasure, an inevitable sensation/question which nobody has said anything about: a quantitative economics [energetics] w/out knowledge of essence
SPEC.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Freud] must try most open, loosest (lockerste, plus lâche) hypothesis to describe pleasure–unpleasure, an inevitable sensation/question which nobody has said anything about: a quantitative economics [energetics] w/out knowledge of essence

SPEC.content: free vs. bound energy > Freud freely interprets free energy as “freely mobile” instead of “freely utilizable” [re: Helmholtz on principles of Carnot-Clausius]
SPEC.linkedContent: free vs. bound energy > Freud freely interprets free energy as “freely mobile” instead of “freely utilizable” [re: Helmholtz on principles of Carnot-Clausius]

SPEC.content: non-simplicity, indirectness > relation btwn pleasure/unpleasure not simple correlation of decrease/increase of (free) energy: inexhaustible reserve for speculation: not substantial riches, but supplementary angles
SPEC.linkedContent: non-simplicity, indirectness > relation btwn pleasure/unpleasure not simple correlation of decrease/increase of (free) energy: inexhaustible reserve for speculation: not substantial riches, but supplementary angles

SPEC.content: time, in Freud, must be thought in differential of pleasure–unpleasure, must be of the party (partie)
SPEC.linkedContent: time, in Freud, must be thought in differential of pleasure–unpleasure, must be of the party (partie)

SPEC.content: Fechner’s “aesthetic indifference” btwn pleasure/unpleasure dropped by Freud > is this not like a free zone, agency of the “duty free” [in English], free exchange for speculation, a means to pass, as authorized contraband, an always ideal border (in both directions)?
SPEC.linkedContent: Fechner’s “aesthetic indifference” btwn pleasure/unpleasure dropped by Freud > is this not like a free zone, agency of the “duty free” [in English], free exchange for speculation, a means to pass, as authorized contraband, an always ideal border (in both directions)?

SPEC.content: is sovereign domination (Herrschaft) of PP feigned or seriously accepted by Freud?
SPEC.linkedContent: is sovereign domination (Herrschaft) of PP feigned or seriously accepted by Freud?

SPEC.content: reality principle as courier, lieutenant, of PP, disciplining disciple, defers enjoyment, the waystation (relais) of a differance (Aufschub), auf dem langen Umwege zur Lust, as if RP produces a socius, institution, contract of discipline
SPEC.linkedContent: reality principle as courier, lieutenant, of PP, disciplining disciple, defers enjoyment, the waystation (relais) of a differance (Aufschub), auf dem langen Umwege zur Lust, as if RP produces a socius, institution, contract of discipline

SPEC.content: when master (PP) submits to the work of the secondary (RP), “submits” to its own lieutenant, addresses to himself simulated engagement via detour of institutional telecommunication—il s’envoie, il s’écrit, PP déchaine en lui l’autre absolu > alterity more irreducible than alterity of opposition
SPEC.linkedContent: when master (PP) submits to the work of the secondary (RP), “submits” to its own lieutenant, addresses to himself simulated engagement via detour of institutional telecommunication—il s’envoie, il s’écrit, PP déchaine en lui l’autre absolu > alterity more irreducible than alterity of opposition

SPEC.content: Freud repeats his arrest, pas de marche: speculative possibility of tout autre (than PP), inscribed in advance w/in it, “l’ouvre d’une scription de l’autre à meme (overlaps) le principe”
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud repeats his arrest, pas de marche: speculative possibility of tout autre (than PP), inscribed in advance w/in it, “l’ouvre d’une scription de l’autre à meme (overlaps) le principe”

SPEC.content: la surface même du “à même (overlap)” does not belong to itself—writing affects the very surface of its support > non-belonging unleashes speculation
SPEC.linkedContent: la surface même du “à même (overlap)” does not belong to itself—writing affects the very surface of its support > non-belonging unleashes speculation

SPEC.content: PP, RP, differance, the same divided, actuality only in the differance, detour, btwn PP & RP > pure pleasure & pure reality are ideal limits, fictions, one as destructive and mortal as the other
SPEC.linkedContent: PP, RP, differance, the same divided, actuality only in the differance, detour, btwn PP & RP > pure pleasure & pure reality are ideal limits, fictions, one as destructive and mortal as the other

SPEC.content: from whichever end (bout) [i.e. pleasure or reality], it is death, inscribed but non-inscribable in structure, in process of structure—stricture: death already (déjà) life death
SPEC.linkedContent: from whichever end (bout) [i.e. pleasure or reality], it is death, inscribed but non-inscribable in structure, in process of structure—stricture: death already (déjà) life death

SPEC.content: death’s scandalous [scandalous to dialectical logic] belonging w/out interiority to pleasure, structure of alteration w/out opposition: there’s no thesis of differance
SPEC.linkedContent: death’s scandalous [scandalous to dialectical logic] belonging w/out interiority to pleasure, structure of alteration w/out opposition: there’s no thesis of differance

SPEC.content: the thesis would be l’arrêt de mort of differance, arresting death in 2 senses [vis-à-vis syntax]: condemns to death & interruption suspending death
SPEC.linkedContent: the thesis would be l’arrêt de mort of differance, arresting death in 2 senses [vis-à-vis syntax]: condemns to death & interruption suspending death

SPEC.content: each time one of [3] “terms” [2 principles +/– differance] goes to the end (va au-bout) of itself, of its other, w/out 3rd party, it is death (l’entorse mortelle qui met fin au retors du calcul)
SPEC.linkedContent: each time one of [3] “terms” [2 principles +/– differance] goes to the end (va au-bout) of itself, of its other, w/out 3rd party, it is death (l’entorse mortelle qui met fin au retors du calcul)

SPEC.content: reality principle’s end (autonomy): cut off from all pleasure, from all auto-affective relation, in service of a pleasure too jealous of itself, that would asphyxiate itself
SPEC.linkedContent: reality principle’s end (autonomy): cut off from all pleasure, from all auto-affective relation, in service of a pleasure too jealous of itself, that would asphyxiate itself

SPEC.content: PP (pleasure principle) as pépé (grandfather, that is, Freud), PR (reality principle) as poste restante
SPEC.linkedContent: PP (pleasure principle) as pépé (grandfather, that is, Freud), PR (reality principle) as poste restante

SPEC.content: if “sexual drives” are beyond reality principle [et RP =PP], are they beyond pleasure principle too? does the sexual resist binding? stricture? the proper? economy?
SPEC.linkedContent: if “sexual drives” are beyond reality principle [et RP =PP], are they beyond pleasure principle too? does the sexual resist binding? stricture? the proper? economy?

SPEC.content: the principle of the functioning of principles, which can only differentiate itself: this structure w/ one term or three-in-one-terms can be exposed w/out calling upon Repression
SPEC.linkedContent: the principle of the functioning of principles, which can only differentiate itself: this structure w/ one term or three-in-one-terms can be exposed w/out calling upon Repression

SPEC.content: is Repression necessary? objective science can’t think qualitative or “subjective” affect, philosophy as phenomenological only thinks presence, psychoanalysis’ concept of Repression permits pleasure to be lived & perceived as unpleasure > but still, is Repression necessary?
SPEC.linkedContent: is Repression necessary? objective science can’t think qualitative or “subjective” affect, philosophy as phenomenological only thinks presence, psychoanalysis’ concept of Repression permits pleasure to be lived & perceived as unpleasure > but still, is Repression necessary?

SPEC.content: Repression upsets logic implicit in all philosophy, pleasure that can’t be felt as such > “cannot be experienced as such”
SPEC.linkedContent: Repression upsets logic implicit in all philosophy, pleasure that can’t be felt as such > “cannot be experienced as such”

SPEC.content: [for Freud?] no mélange of pleasure–unpleasure is possible, mélange is madness > though topical distribution [in Beyond…] is effect of differance, it retains differance in reassuring medium & in oppositional logic > principle of identity is respected by topology, division of sites
SPEC.linkedContent: [for Freud?] no mélange of pleasure–unpleasure is possible, mélange is madness > though topical distribution [in Beyond…] is effect of differance, it retains differance in reassuring medium & in oppositional logic > principle of identity is respected by topology, division of sites

SPEC.content: death drive: être à l’oeuvre déjà (in PP), ça se sera écrit en silence—in speculative overflow
SPEC.linkedContent: death drive: être à l’oeuvre déjà (in PP), ça se sera écrit en silence—in speculative overflow

SPEC.content: PP always revient to itself, haunted by tout autre, retour never “acquits” speculation of PP
SPEC.linkedContent: PP always revient to itself, haunted by tout autre, retour never “acquits” speculation of PP

SPEC.content: PP cannot be contradicted (contredit); Freud confirms PP in its absolute sovereignty
SPEC.linkedContent: PP cannot be contradicted (contredit); Freud confirms PP in its absolute sovereignty

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s “speculative” writing] démarche of this writing, advancing w/out advancing, time of a detour, pas de thèse repeats itself: PP will not let anything be done w/out it, except repetition itself
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s “speculative” writing] démarche of this writing, advancing w/out advancing, time of a detour, pas de thèse repeats itself: PP will not let anything be done w/out it, except repetition itself

SPEC.content: Wiederholungszwang (repetition compulsion) put in communication w/ death drive
SPEC.linkedContent: Wiederholungszwang (repetition compulsion) put in communication w/ death drive

SPEC.content: fort/da: story of the PP (grandfather & pleasure principle)
SPEC.linkedContent: fort/da: story of the PP (grandfather & pleasure principle)

SPEC.content: Freud his own grandson? put PP in question—Freud makes hypothesis of beyond [the PP] come back (revenir) only to dismiss (congédier) it again, that which comes back (revient) hasn’t truly come back (revenu) > only passed by in specter of its presence
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud his own grandson? put PP in question—Freud makes hypothesis of beyond [the PP] come back (revenir) only to dismiss (congédier) it again, that which comes back (revient) hasn’t truly come back (revenu) > only passed by in specter of its presence

SPEC.content: Freud: Herrschaft of pleasure principle
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud: Herrschaft of pleasure principle

SPEC.content: repetition, reproductivity, works w/out saying anything, like death drive, not even “form,” w/out thesis, de-monstration makes its proof (preuve) sans montrer > de-monstration folds into everything it makes explicit, pas de démonstration remains (reste) in this restance
SPEC.linkedContent: repetition, reproductivity, works w/out saying anything, like death drive, not even “form,” w/out thesis, de-monstration makes its proof (preuve) sans montrer > de-monstration folds into everything it makes explicit, pas de démonstration remains (reste) in this restance

SPEC.content: for Freud, not Angst, not Furcht (fear), only Schreck (terror) causes trauma
SPEC.linkedContent: for Freud, not Angst, not Furcht (fear), only Schreck (terror) causes trauma

SPEC.content: Freud’s haste, urgency, to solve the problem of beyond the PP is something other, of another order: not the demonstrative declaration or manifest argument [like Rousseau in OG]
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s haste, urgency, to solve the problem of beyond the PP is something other, of another order: not the demonstrative declaration or manifest argument [like Rousseau in OG]

SPEC.content: [re: fort/da]: selbstgeschaffene (self-invented) game, spontaneity, auto-production, self-engendering of repetition itself, hetero-tautology (definition of Hegelian speculative): gives time, there is time
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: fort/da]: selbstgeschaffene (self-invented) game, spontaneity, auto-production, self-engendering of repetition itself, hetero-tautology (definition of Hegelian speculative): gives time, there is time

SPEC.content: “[PP, the spool, ça, SA, Ernst, Freud] fait semblant d’eloigner le PP pour le ramener sans cesse, pour constater qu’il se ramène lui-même” [hetero-tautology? bringing it all back home]

SPEC.content: fort/da and Freud’s speculative game: same application
SPEC.linkedContent: fort/da and Freud’s speculative game: same application

SPEC.content: en abyme of Freud’s writing [re: autobiography in fort/da narrative] has relation of structural mimesis w/ relation btwn PP & “its” death drive—latter hollows out the former en abyme, at origin of origin

SPEC.content: for Freud, in game of fort/da, the greatest pleasure is the re-turn (re-venir), Wiederkommen: yet, again becoming revenant, [spool] must be thrown away again > [Freud, the game] speculates on the return (retour): au départ de ce qui se doit de revenir

SPEC.linkedContent: what binds (lie) game to itself is re- of return, the returned or the returning (le revenu ou le revenant), revenance orders entire teleology, can be handed over to PP

SPEC.content: force of disappearance, of “fort” > capitalized pleasure (plaisir) (idealization) does w/out what it needs: one provides oneself w/ head of what one needs by doing w/out it (to have it)

SPEC.content: Freud assumes a curiosity w/out excuse
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud assumes a curiosity w/out excuse

SPEC.content: “literary fiction” in fort:da, fait-oeuvre in abyss of these repetitions, fairies, demons, unheimlich repetitions, what is most gripping (saisissant) and ungraspable (insaisissable) about Beyond…, for Freud too, who believed he could affix the seal of the Freuds to it [Beyond…] while hearing voices

SPEC.linkedContent: bind always serves PP, to understand one must hear several voices, speak several languages, & count w/ several generations of computers [baby daddy]

SPEC.content: speculating, “author” already no longer there, no longer responsible, leaves document in your hands > “literary”: make of it what you will, it’s up to you—you’re more than ever on board

SPEC.content: no theses in science or literature (athetic), every thesis is philosophical
SPEC.linkedContent: no theses in science or literature (athetic), every thesis is philosophical

SPEC.content: capital front [bobine (Ernst’s spool) as face, cap as head], where PP might be placed out of action > to rout a mastery, so one doesn’t just end up w/ one’s couriers, offspring, lieutenants

SPEC.linkedContent: PP as author or as authority, it/he only increased by dissidents speaking against it

SPEC.content: 2 repetitions (2 logics) as constitutive duplicity, double bind

SPEC.linkedContent: for Freud, adults should tend toward novelty > compulsively repetitive demand is beyond the PP, adult acts like child

SPEC.linkedContent: demonic, archive of its own demon: undissolved transference, like unpaid debt of inheritance, one can begin an inheritance thus: laissée en sommeil, la menace ainsi enkystée [pocket]

SPEC.content: notion of guarding (garde) is gathered, guarded (particularly in its strategico-military code), at moment Freud defines conservative drives: they are the guardians/sentinels of life (Lebenswachter), veillent sur la vie, la surveillent, gardent et regardent, montent la garde auprès d’elle > but they are also the satellites (Trabanten) or sentinels of death > Myrmidons, bodyguards, satelles, agents (generally armed), couriers, obeying revolution of a greater body (absolute power): le mort

SPEC.content: resolution, solution [of Freud’s argument?]: band closer, mount tension until released [these are Freud’s schemas] > relating what Freud says to what he does (writing’s démarche, its performance), interlacings can no longer be undone, can’t be closed or opened—trait divided [see p. 391n double chiasmatic invagination of borders]: there can be no accounting, reckoning

SPEC.linkedContent: PP as quasi-proper, figure of mastery, exappropriation structures PP, proper produced as autothanatography

SPEC.content: function of binding (not machinelike regularity [?]), function of stricture as original as the X about which we can only know once banded, once represented by representatives
SPEC.linkedContent: function of binding (not machinelike regularity [?]), function of stricture as original as the X about which we can only know once banded, once represented by representatives

SPEC.content: to bind is to supplement/substitute, thus represent, Ersatz in place of what stricture inhibits/forbids, to bind is also to detach, detaches a representative, sends it on a mission, a missive liberated to fulfill destiny of what it represents: a post effect, de facteur préposé à l’acheminement ——the secondary (supplementary stricture) transforms freely mobile into immobile cathectic energy: posits, posts—here’s a thesis: immobilized cathexis is more tonic, tonicity related to effects of binding (elasticity & tension), thus binden as bander (erection): “bander: poster, liason: postale”
SPEC.linkedContent: to bind is to supplement/substitute, thus represent, Ersatz in place of what stricture inhibits/forbids, to bind is also to detach, detaches a representative, sends it on a mission, a missive liberated to fulfill destiny of what it represents: a post effect, de facteur préposé à l’acheminement ——the secondary (supplementary stricture) transforms freely mobile into immobile cathectic energy: posits, posts—here’s a thesis: immobilized cathexis is more tonic, tonicity related to effects of binding (elasticity & tension), thus binden as bander (erection): “bander: poster, liason: postale”

SPEC.linkedContent: pas de PP btwn 2 functions (Binden, general return to Nirvana)

SPEC.content: skepsis, maieutics [in Freud]—division btwn differance & opposition marked in Philebus (12E) > Beyond… in turn becoming supplementary chapter of Philebus, Philebus deciphers it from afar like a teleguided reading device, Philebus reads Beyond…, is lodged in it > this setting adrift is programmed by discourse on apeiron: Socrates’ last word of Philebus: “let go” [baby daddy]

SPEC.content: pleasure—ungraspable limit btwn 2 limits, un en-deçà et un au-delà qui réduisent un pas à rien ——producing itself, regenerating: only pleasure, pleasure as counter-pleasure, band contra band, tout se passe alors dans des différences de bandage—not general economy (absolute expenditure) but strictural economy (to the point of its inevitable collapse)
